section01.title: TRAINING
section01.content: Working with the Hong Kong Blockchain Society and the various universities and colleges of Hong Kong, training sessions are provided for free to current and recent students (graduated within 3 years inclusive as of the 1st of September 2019) via training.ibcol.org; on-campus instruction is cancelled until further notice.

section02.title: MENTORSHIP
section02.desc: HSBC staff will provide professional mentorship to the students of Hong Kong in the areas of, but not limited to, digital banking, FinTech and communication skills. Mentors will give presentations, interact with students in smaller groups at the event, and general networking with professionals from HSBC.

content.desc: Competitors prove that they have a stake in the competition by submitting a minimum viable whitepaper outline.
Competitors prove that they have completed the work required to be competitive, i.e the last day to edit their paper.

section04.title: COMPETITION
section04.contentHTML: The HK-BCOL Finals is held 13 June 2020 at the City University of Hong Kong.
